programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: HS football coach Ed Thomas is a legend in Parkersburg, Iowa, who had mentored multiple players into the NFL, and kids even had a poster of him on their walls; when he is gunned down during an early morning workout, the entire town is shocked.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: On the surface the Carters seemed like a happy family of Iowa farmers, but when they discover Shirley Carter shot to death in her kitchen, the family begins pointing fingers at each other.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Iowa farmer Tom Lyon is excited when a nearby plot of land goes up for sale, but he isn't the only one. When Lyon's body is discovered at the bottom of a well, the trail of blood leads through that very land.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: The people of Defiance, Iowa, find it strange when Scott Shanahan disappears, leaving his wife and kids, but Scott is always unpredictable and no one gives it much more thought.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defense's medical expert evaluated the severe health conditions of Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick; both sought out the retired pathologist Dr. Jack Kevorkian to end their pain and suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: During crosss-examination of a mental health expert, the State brought up the role of a pathologist in treating living patients.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The same doctor who testified in Doctor Jack Kevorkian's earlier trial faced cross-examination in this case; Dr. Stanley Levy reviewed the medical reports of both Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick before they died.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defense's clinical psychiatrist testified under cross-examination after reviewing some documents; Dr. Bernard Carroll evaluated both Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defense's clinical psychiatrist slammed prosecutors in Doctor Jack Kevorkian's trial calling them vindictive and petty; he had reviewed information about both Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Both sides are arguing legal issues in the trial of Doctor Jack Kevorkian; he was accused of violating Michigan's state law banning physician-assisted suicides when he helped Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick end their pain and suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Jurors heard from an advocate for physician-assisted suicides in Dr. Jack Kevorkian's trial; Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick suffered from debilitating illnesses and reached out to Kevorkian for help.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The defendant takes the stand in his own trial; it's Dr. Jack Kevorkian's turn to try to convince jurors he is not guilty; he was accused of breaking the law in assisting the suicides of Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Death Row Or Life In Prison?
programme.desc: Jury deliberations began for a second time in this trial. This time it was a matter of life or death. Jurors would need to decide whether or not Scott Nelson should face the death penalty for his role in the murder of Jennifer Fulford.

programme.title: The Death of Baby Dylan
programme.sub-title: Parents Accused of Murdering Their Infant Child
programme.desc: The body of Dylan Groves, an innocent, vulnerable infant, was found at the bottom of a 30-foot well near the family home; his parents, Jessica and Daniel Groves, face eleven felony counts including murder.

programme.title: The Death of Baby Dylan
programme.desc: The nurse who helped deliver baby Dylan Groves is the first to testify for the State of Ohio; her testimony describes a mother giving birth to a child while she was under the influence of drugs.

programme.title: The Death of Baby Dylan
programme.sub-title: Parents Lose Custody of Child at Birth
programme.desc: Immediately after his birth Dylan Groves was separated from his parents because the hospital found illicit drugs in his system; the nurses who first testify go into detail on Dylan's condition in the hours and days following his birth.

programme.title: The Death of Baby Dylan
programme.desc: Social workers were called in to take custody of baby Dylan Groves after he was born in the hospital because his mother and father were both drug addicts; the child tested positive for illegal substances at birth.

programme.title: The Death of Baby Dylan
programme.desc: The first set of witnesses introduced are nurses and social workers who had to take newborn Dylan into state custody due to drug use by his mother, co-defendant Jessica Groves.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard more details about the physical evidence found in the area where John O'Keefe was discovered.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: A sergeant from the Massachusetts State Police took the stand. Yuriy Bukhenik was the supervisor of the lead detective in the investigation into the death of John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors saw the physical evidence collected by investigators. It included the clothing and sneakers John O'Keefe was wearing the night before he was found in a pile of snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: A state police sergeant testified about the early days of the investigation into John O'Keefe's death.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors turned the jury's attention to surveillance video from the hours leading up to John O'Keefe's death.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Hours before John O'Keefe lost his life, he and his girlfriend, Karen Read, were out at a bar with friends.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Austin, Texas, TV executive Steven Beard is shot as he sleeps; with only a single shotgun shell to go on, police follow a trail from mansions and country clubs to bookstores and hospital psych wards.
